thread.title: Arsenal's Gunnersaurus in Jurassic Park scene to promote Bayern clash
thread.title_full: Arsenal's Gunnersaurus in Jurassic Park scene to promote Bayern clash

author: Chris Wright
title: Arsenal's Gunnersaurus in Jurassic Park scene to promote Bayern clash
text:
50 minutes ago Arsenal's Gunnersaurus in Jurassic Park scene to promote Bayern clash 
With Arsenal facing a mammoth task in their Champions League second leg against Bayern Munich, a suitably epic theme was chosen for BT Sport's match promo. 
Indeed, with a tip of the hat to "Jurassic Park," artist Dan Leydon redrafted the infamous T-Rex scene to feature Arsenal's mascot, Gunnersaurus Rex, stumbling upon a rather vulnerable Carlo Ancelotti. �� There's a Jurassic Park spin on #ChampionsDraw No.42: - BT Sport Football (@btsportfootball) March 7, 2017 
With the Gunners needing to chase down a massive 5-1 aggregate deficit, replacing the ferocious T-Rex with the cuddly Gunnersaurus and Ancelotti nonchalantly raising an eyebrow in trademark fashion neatly sum up Arsene Wenger's team's chances of reaching the quarterfinals. 
Arsenal fans at the Emirates on Tuesday night should take heed of the warning uttered by Samuel L. Jackson's character in the 1993 blockbuster: "Hold on to your butts!" 
Chris covers the funny side of the game for ESPN FC in the Toe Poke blog.
